item.title: 3 Types of Clouds You Should Know About
item.description: The increasing popularity of cloud-based IT services might leave you wondering if you’re missing out. To help you decide, let’s explore the three primary cloud types and which applications are well-suited for cloud environments. These days, it seems everyone is offering cloud services, primarily based on three architectures: public, private, and hybrid clouds. The most common is the public cloud, a specialized data center owned and operated by a provider serving numerous paying customers concurrently.

item.title: Backing Up Broadband
item.description: Over the past few decades, broadband internet has become essential for businesses, with speeds and data usage skyrocketing. This begs the question: what happens if your internet goes down? We’ve Quietly Become Dependent The shift to digital operations has been so gradual that many businesses don’t realize the impact of a complete internet outage. You understand the consequences of a power outage, but have you considered how to maintain operations if your internet connection fails?
